page.title: 20RHONDDA 1985
page.content: RHONDDA IS NOW A GREEN AND BEAUTIFUL VALLEY.FORESTS CLOTHE THE HILLSIDES. THE STREAMS AND RIVERS ARE ONCE MORE CLEAN AND USED FOR TROUT FISHING. WITHIN MINUTES ONE CAN CLIMB ABOVE THE ROWS OF TERRACED HOUSES AND ENJOY THE VIEWS AND FRESH MOUNTAIN AIR.TWO MOUNTAIN ROADS WITH PANORAMIC VIEWS MAKE EASY ACCESS TO THE COAST WITHIN HALF AN HOUR,TO RESORTS SUCH AS PORTHCAWL,OGMORE,ABERAVON,THE GOWER PENINSULA,BARRY ISLAND AND AIRPORT. WITH IMAGINATION AND INVESTMENT RHONDDA COULD BE DEVELOPED AS A TOURIST AREA. {HOWEVER,WITH ALL THE ABOVE CHANGES, {RHONDDA IS STILL ONE OF THE MOST {DEPRIVED DISTRICTS IN THE U.K.IN A {GOVERNMENT SURVEY, WHICH INCLUDED {UNEMPLOYMENT,HOUSING,EDUC. AND AGE, {THEY WERE UNABLE TO FIND ANYWHERE IN {ENGLAND OR WALES THAT COULD COMPARE.
